Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-PHa (PSPHa, XXA; UCLL1c; Ala-rich; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: skin secretions, Orange-legged Leaf Frog,Pithecopus hypochondrialis, South America

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 94.7% similarity toAP971: Phylloseptin-H12. It differs from AP971 only by one residue N17 in this peptide and D in AP971.Structure:  Helical in 50% TFE.Activity: Active against S. aureus or MRSA NCTC 12497 (MIC 32.97 uM), MBEC =33 uM, E.faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 263.78 uM), E.coli NCTC 10418 (MIC >263.78 uM), and C.albicans NCYC 1467 (MIC 131.89 uM).Toxicity:  50% hemo.lytic concentration (HC50) 109 uM. anticancer effect: LD50 (MTT assays) 28.48-37.96 uM to cancer cells MB435s, H157, PC-3, U251MG, HCT116, and MCF-7 (Liu et al., 2019).  Updated 8/2020
Literature Information.Author: Liu J, Wu Q, Li L, Xi X, Wu D, Zhou M, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L.2017
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of Phylloseptins that Defense against Gram-Positive Bacteria and Inhibit the Proliferation of the Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Cell Line, from the Skin Secretions of Phyllomedusa Frogs
